meanings.definition: A swimming stroke performed on one's side, with arms moving in opposite directions and legs kicking simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: During the race, she used the sidestroke to move quickly through the water.
meanings.sent2: He learned the sidestroke at swimming lessons and now swims effortlessly with it.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimming team decided to perform a routine using only the sidestroke, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: In the pool of life, she gracefully navigated through challenges with the sidestroke, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The coach demonstrated the sidestroke, emphasizing the importance of proper technique.

meanings.definition: To swim using the sidestroke technique.
meanings.sent1: She prefers to sidestroke when swimming in open water to conserve energy.
meanings.sent2: They will sidestroke across the lake to reach the other side before sunset.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he challenged his friend to a race, only allowing them to sidestroke.
meanings.sent4: As the waves of life hit hard, she sidestroked her way through, staying afloat.
meanings.sent5: The swim instructor encouraged the students to practice and perfect their sidestroke technique.
